intro: Ophiorrhiza subumbellata, commonly known as the slender sandalwood, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or coastal forest environments. It has a compact growth habit and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
